I'd highly recommend giving "Drive" (2011) a watch! It's an engaging crime drama that features Ryan Gosling in a captivating performance as a stunt driver and part-time getaway driver for heists. The story unfolds in the midst of Los Angeles, blending action with a suspenseful narrative.

Additionally, if you enjoy intricate detective stories, "Zero Effect" (1998) might be right up your alley. This film stars Ben Stiller as a brilliant yet socially awkward detective who investigates a complex blackmail case for a mysterious tycoon, creating an entertaining mix of humor and mystery. Enjoy the movies!

Alternatively, if you prefer a more gritty and action-packed heist narrative, "Triple 9" might be right up your alley. This film explores the complex web of crime and corruption in Atlanta as a gang of criminals and corrupt cops plan an ambitious heist while also manipulating a police officer's murder to create a distraction.

Based on your preference for a heist genre movie directed by Roger Donaldson and written by Andy Tennant, I'd highly recommend "Inside Man" (2006). This thrilling film features an intricate plot with high-stakes negotiations after a brilliant bank heist turns into a hostage situation. Denzel Washington delivers a captivating performance in this movie that might suit your taste.

If you're interested in something a bit more fantastical, Monsters, Inc. (2001) is an animated adventure with humor and heart. Bill Farmer, John Goodman, James Coburn, and Jennifer Tilly lend their voices to this Pixar classic about monsters who need children's screams to power their city. It might not be a typical heist movie, but its plot offers unexpected twists that could appeal to you!
